page.title: 02Walton and Street
page.content: At the northern edge of the block the land is low lying and at about 5m above sea level forms part of the {Somerset Levels}or{moors. The River Brue is at the north-east edge of our area and only a few small streams and man-made ditches, called rhynes in Somerset, drain into it, including the{Bullmead Ditch}and the {Small Moor Rhyne. We have two primary{schools}in our area Brookside and Walton, and one special school, Avalon. At the age of eleven children from Brookside and Walton go to Crispin secondary school at the eastern end of the town of Street. The older buildings in this area are constructed from{Blue Lias,}a kind of limestone, but buiding since the sixties has largely been in brick or in reconstituted stone.
